description: The Tesla billionaire took the stand in a civil defamation trial in Los Angeles.
title: Elon Musk’s Defense: ‘Pedo Guy’ Tweet Was a Generic Insult
title_page: Elon Musk’s Defense: ‘Pedo Guy’ Tweet Was a Generic Insult - The New York Times
maintext:
Those were among the opening volleys in the trial of Mr. Unsworth’s defamation suit against Mr. Musk.
In his opening statement, Mr. Musk’s lawyer, Alex Spiro, characterized “pedo guy” as a generic insult and an expression from Mr. Musk’s youth in South Africa.
“These are joking talking tweets in a fight between men,” Mr. Spiro said.
Mr. Musk added in his testimony: “‘Pedo guy’ is used in other countries also. It’s quite common in the English-speaking world. I’m quite confident if you do a search, it will just say ‘creepy old dude.’”
Mr. Unsworth’s lawyer, L. Lin Wood, aiming to show that Mr. Musk had instead implied that Mr. Unsworth was a pedophile, cited a tweet in which Mr. Musk wrote, “Bet you a signed dollar that it’s true.”
Mr. Musk countered on the stand that “if I really thought it was true, I would have sent more than a dollar.” He said he didn’t know if the statement that Mr. Unsworth was a pedophile was “true or false” and added: “I also did not literally mean that he was a pedophile. I meant he was a creep.”
The trial stems from a war of words that took place between the two men in the summer of 2018 as they raced to offer assistance to a youth soccer team that had been trapped by rising waters in a cave in Thailand, an ordeal that transfixed the world.
